name: Outrigger Waikiki on the Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband and I stayed at the Outrigger for 2 nights for part of our honeymoon. This hotel is beautiful, the bathroom is big and everything is brand new, the rooms are nice and clean, and the balconies are really nice. We had a partial ocean view, that was ok, but it was nice to be able to look at at the city. There are two really good restaurants in the hotel, Hula Grill and Duke's. Make sure you try the banana mac nut pancakes at Hula grill , sooooo good. Dukes also has a bar right on the beach! The location is great, literally right on waikiki beach. I would definitely recommend this hotel and in fact I wouldn't stay anywhere else!
reviews.title: Outrigger, perfect hotel in Oahu

likes.liked: — The location and the condition of the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent the second week of our honeymoon at the Outrigger Waikiki. Check in was easy, we arrived a little early, so they took our baggage and we stopped at Dukes for lunch. We had a partial ocean view room on the Cheesecake factory side of the hotel. We did hear the exhaust fan when we were on our deck, but it wasn't annoying. The sunsets were very nice from our balcony. Beds were comfy, bathroom very nice, room was made up prompty each day. The room had free ethernet with cables in the desk and free long distance within the US. The elevators did take awhile at times, but overall, didn't hold us up much.
reviews.title: Best location on Waikiki!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got coffees at the Seattle Coffee company in the lower lobby, if you get the Big Kahuna package, you can use your 5 dollar vouchers there and essentially get a light breakfast for free each day. We had lunch at Dukes twice, which was reasonable and very good, you could also order for a smaller menu poolside. There was a small deli (Pai) near the pool which was extremely well priced and the sandwiches were a perfect light lunch. Drinks were great at Dukes and the Hawaiian beers were excellent, especially Kona Big Wave.
reviews.title: Enjoyed every minute

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We mixed it up between the beach and the pool. Definitely hit the beach early and rent lounge chairs and an umbrella. Never had a problem getting seats by the pool. It is not a quiet beach/pool experience, so don't expect it. It was a mixed group of people, friends traveling, honeymooners, and families. Bar service at the pool was excellent...and yes, bring your ID, but once the girls get to know you, you don't need it.
reviews.title: Great Place!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Outrigger Waikiki is definitely in the hub of Waikiki, it is walking distance to great shopping and great restaurants. We mostly relaxed, since we had an action packed week before in Maui, but we thought Pearl Harbor and Diamond Head were well worth it. We also checked out the Magic of Polynesia across the street, fun, but not essential, and a little costly. The revolving restaurant across the street was a fun stop for a nightcap.
reviews.title: Great place to stay on Waikiki beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: This hotel can boast the perfect location: right on the beach (no hassle crossing busy Kalakaua Ave). Room: extremely clean & comfortable, with in-room fridge (also safe, iron/ironing board), and nice bathroom (granite finish). Upgrade, from city to ocean view, was a definite plus. I am particularly picky, but would not hesitate in staying at this hotel again. Restaurants (again, on the beach) are enjoyable, esp. Dukes (don’t be put off by its “pickup bar” demeanor).
reviews.title: Great accommodation: right on the beach...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel. I'd dare to say the best you'll find in Waikiki. This isn't because it is a great facility, but rather its absolute prime location. It is directly across the street from the International Marketplace, a truly fascinating part of Hawaii and for sure a great souvenir stop. It’s within walking distance to the zoo, surfing, and almost the entire strip.
reviews.title: Great Stay ay Outrigger Waikiki on the Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006
reviews.text: HIGH POINTS: This hotel has a friendly and helpful staff that will seek to engage you. I find this far different from many other shops, restaurants, and hotels you are likely to encounter in Hawaii. For example, each day my wife and two small children set out to explore locations on the East and North shores. The valets would see to it that we had accurate direction in hand no matter how long it took. (At no point did they push for a tip or could they assume they were getting one- but of course they did). Housekeeping frequently made it a point to engage us to find out if there was anything else we needed. Our room, although small, was well appointed and very comfortable. It had a very nice bathroom and (empty) refrigerator. Free in-room internet and WIFI in the lobby and pool area. But, there is nowhere to sit!!
reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: LOW POINTS: Check in can be abrupt. They do seem a little too serious for the setting. The overall facility is much smaller than their website would make it seem. There is one relatively small pool and a small hot tub. There are no kiddy pools or even a shallow end. The total square footage devoted to outdoor activity (aside from public beach) is far too small to support the number of rooms and guests, but they do make it seem less crowded through an intelligent multi-level design.
reviews.title: The Outrigger 'Scoop!'
wouldnt stay anywhere else
reviews.text: FOOD: The hotel has at least 2 (I think more) excellent restaurants. We ate many times at Duke’s and found it to be excellent food and an unbelievable bargain compared to other food in the area. For example; on Mother’s day, all 4 of us ate at their Sunday brunch for $35 with a nice tip. The food was some of the best I had on a 3 week trip to various islands in Hawaii. When compared to the $20 we spent eating a Waikiki fast-food breakfast on the way to the Zoo (also close), it truly seems like a bargain. The only major issue is the lack of sit down restaurants in the direct vicinity of the hotel. The only one was Cheesecake factory which had a perpetual 80-90 minute wait (total waste of time). In the end, we opted to eat at the most multi-cultural food court probably one of the best the planet many nights, the food court of the International market. It was great and a 2 minute walk. There was everything from cold coconuts, to sushi, hamburgers, Korean BBQ, pizza, Mexican, local cuisine… all excellent and frequently accompanied by a free show.

reviews.title: Loved the Outrigger
reviews.text: We had a week stay at the Outrigger & loved it. The location is excellent, right on Waikiki Beach with great views to Diamond Head & across the road from the International Marketplace (lovely shopping!!).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was a city view but the view from our balcony to Waikiki Beach was quite nice - not prime beach but a much better view than I imagined. Duke's bar is a nice place to sit back with a drink & a meal and just take in the views & the atmosphere. All the hotel staff were friendly & helpful.
reviews.title: Times Square Meets the Tropics

likes.liked: — The spacious and beautifully decorated rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can agree with some other postings about hearing noises from adjoining rooms - we could hear toilets flushing & certain "other" noises....
reviews.title: Great Place

likes.disliked: — Having to pay for the room upgrade

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Overall our stay at the Outrigger was great, we would recommend it to anyone as the location can't be beat.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a first trip to Hawaii and we started with Oahu. The Outrigger Waikiki was in the center of all the action, making it very convenient if you can overlook the noise and the congestion.
reviews.title: Fantastic View
Great hotel, great location!
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Outrigger Waikiki on what was our second trip to Hawaii. We saw the hotel on our first trip and were keen to stay there so booked it second time around. We booked a partial ocean view room and were upgraded on arrival to an ocean view room (by request). The ocean view room was fine although the view wasnt as good as our previous visit since it is a bit restricted. We stayed in room 1219 which is on the left hand side of the hotel and were close enough to the hear the ocean and the people enjoying the beach. It doesnt get the sun in the afternoon though! The room was nice, spacious and clean and the staff very friendly. The main thing about this hotel in our opinion is the location and the bars/restaurants downstairs. Duke's is a fantastic bar with a great atmosphere, great cocktails and you must try the Beach Fries. The food is also great and offers you the choice of eating in the bar or in the restaurant - although best to make reservations if you dont like waiting. We also sampled Chuck's Steakhouse which was also fantastic. We loved the hotel because of the closeness to the beach. The pool area also looked very good and at weekends, had entertainment which was nice to listen to as you lie on the beach. Overall, whilst it would be nice to have a full ocean front room, we had a great time at the Outrigger, thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay there again.

reviews.title: This hotel is wonderful.............. We loved every minute
reviews.text: We were just in Hawaii on vacation. The island is beautiful and this hotel it top notch. We had wonderful service, the rooms were cleaned every day, the service people were very friendly, checking in is very smooth. This hotel is lovely, the lobby and waiting areas are a pleasant place to be. Can't say enough about the staff, they were all very friendly and made you feel like they were really glad you were there. The beach area is clean, pools and hot tubs were clean and had plenty of chairs as long has you were there to reserve one by 9am or so. Don't miss the "Circle Island tour" This was very informative and you got to see some of the other side of the island. Great deal for the money. We also did Germains luau and for the money this was not something that we will do again but not disappointed that we did it once. The show is acutally about 1/2 hour longer than it should be. And of course we did the Pearl Harbor Tour that everyone should do at least once. Overall I think our choice of hotel was the best (and we checked out many.) We have already booked next years vacation and we are staying at the OUTRIGGER WIKIKI ON THE BEACH again. The vacation was a great success and the staff at this hotel is great!!!! We had a wonderful vacation and I hope you will to.

reviews.title: Outrigger Waikiki Is the Best
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Outrigger Waikiki and loved every minute of our stay. Everyone in the hotel was friendly and willing to help. The beach was wonderful. My husband had never been to Hawaii before. After checking into the hotel we went to Duke's Canoe Club for dinner. Our dining experience is one we will always treasure as we sipped Mai Tai's and watched a beautiful sunset. During our dinner at Duke's were Hawaiian singers strolling through the restaurant adding to the tropical ambiance that we longed to experience. Our stay at this hotel was completely relaxing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: We just returned from Oahu and had a great time at the Outrigger. We stayed 2 nights in a City View room and loved every minute. We also stayed at the Ko Olina Beach Club for the next 2 nights, as my husband loves the city and I love peace and quiet, so we arranged for both. I was pleasantly surprised by how much I enjoyed the Outrigger and Waikiki.
reviews.title: Great vacation!
Terrific Honeymoon stay
reviews.text: The hotel is tastefully decorated in Hawaiin themes, clean, and has the Aloha spirit. Even though our room was a City View, we still had a nice view of the ocean. We requested a room on the opposite side of the Cheesecake Factory and didn't hear any fan noise, although the street noise can be a little loud at times. The beds were comfortable and the bathrooms had everything including large granite countertops, make up mirrors, free safe, frig, and wonderful shampoos. Wish I could buy more of those! The room also had free internet access.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I booked a week at the JW Ihilani Marriott in Ko Olina. While the resort was very nice, we are young and advernturous and got very bored!!! After having lunch at Duke's one day, we decided to check out of the JW Ihilani and come stay at the Outrigger Waikiki. We were very excited to get upgraded to an ocean view and FREE long distance!!! Great when I needed to call my husband's cell. There were also two free waters in our fridge which was a nice welcome after paying $4 at JW Ihilani. The price was $229 and WELL worth it! Bed was okay, view was awesome. We went on the canoe at the beach and had a blast. We ate at Dukes for breakfast and lunch and you really can't beat it. Great prices, great food, great music, and awesome view. The girls at the front remembered us each time. Free coffee for guests. Gift shops were surprisingly well priced. We had dinner at a sister hotel called Ocean View? Something like that, and it was good. We walked there on the strip, had dinner, and made our way back on the beach stopping at each hotel bar for a drink. It was perfect after having such a quiet week at JW Ihilani. If your looking for fun, excitement and people watching this is the place!
reviews.title: Great Fun after Ko Olina!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Outrigger on the Beach with my parents recently. I was very distraught that I had made the arrangments for us to stay here while my brother was getting married at the Halekulani down the street. You enter the hotel on the busiest strip of Waikiki Beach, which is certainly not the Hawaii of serene Paradise but of cheesy t-shirts shops, chain restaurants and hoards of people. As we ascended the elevator I noticed only the horribly ugly rugs that cover the lobby area and, again, hoards of people in line for one of the Outrigger's three restaurants. Our rooms were "ocean view" on the 3rd floor. My parents room had an obstructed view and was very small. Our room was bigger and had a full ocean view (we paid the same rate). We thought we were the lucky ones until we opened our sliding glass doors to hear the noise from Duke's Waikiki right below our balcony. It was loud out there until well after midnight and, after that, the noise moved to the hotel hallways. In the end, it was not horrible and it was not wonderful, it was just simply fine and disappointing given some of the other hotels we saw on the strip. The place had an overall feeling of Spring Break or Girls Gone Wild. Duke's was a madhouse most of the day and we fell asleep each night to some bad Jimmy Buffet song streaming up through our room as the backdrop to drunk people laughing and carrying on. Now, I am not against a good time but when a hotel bar will only give you "one drink per person" and you are traveling with people in their 40s and 60s, this has got to be a sign. If you want a relaxing stay (tough for Waikiki) at a beautiful hotel, travel further down the beach and spring for the Halekulani!
reviews.title: Don't Stay Here -- Unless You are on Spring Break

likes.liked: — Free phone call and wireless. Nice staff.

reviews.text: We wanted to stay on Waikiki for one night pre-cruise and chose the Outrigger because I happened to find a great deal (<$200 per night) on their website one day, which I never saw again.
reviews.title: Loved It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: We opted for a standard "city" view room. Upon check-in I (barely) mentioned wanting something on the quiet side of the hotel (after reading previous reviews here) and was given a partial ocean view room with no hesitation at no extra charge. The room was clean, modern and tastefully decorated. I really felt like I was in Hawaii upon entering.
reviews.title: be careful you get what you pay for.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We felt the service was great and even my 11 year old commented on how good it was.
reviews.title: Overall good experience
I had a GREAT time!
reviews.text: I'm going to make this short and sweet. The hotel was great...the staff was accommodating the restaurants were great and yummy. I loved that it was central to everything and the beach was amazing :) The only comments I have to make on the more negative side were that the walls are super thin and the elevators took too long at times. Other than that I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone looking to stay in Waikiki!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a partial ocean view for 8 nights at the outrigger. We were told on arrival we were being upgraded for free to an ocean front room.. the man who checked us in kept saying not to tell anyone he would get fired for upgrading is for free.. he made a big deal out of it, however we were not upgraded. That was my only complaint about the outrigger.. we were fine with the room we booked untill we thought we had an upgrade only to find out we were lied to. That being said...
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel, a perfect vacation..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room:
reviews.title: My favorite Hotel in Waikiki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we were on the cheesecake factory side of the building directly beside the fan, where everyone said is the worst place to be, however we had no problems. The part of our view that was ocean was wonderful, and the part that was city was nice too. The fan was not very loud and when the door was closed you couldnt hear it at all from inside the room. You could hear a flush from the bathroom next dr in the middle of the night but nothing you would hear if you werent already awake. The Bed's were comfortable, room was cleaned well every day. It was not a huge room, but a very good size for the two of us. Loved the in room fridge, we were always bringing home leftovers and eating some the next day.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food:
reviews.title: a very good hotel in an excellent location

likes.liked: — location, the beach itself, the good size room and reasonable price
likes.disliked: — the extra payment for using umbrellas ans beach chairs

reviews.title: You cant do better than this.
reviews.text: My husband and i stayed at the Outrigger Waikiki on the Beach from Sept 5 - 9 2007. It was right in the middle of EVERYTHING, and right across the street from the Int'l Market Place. We were on the 10th floor and had an ocean front delux, it was a corner unit and we had a breathtaking view of Diamond Head. Next time i would probably go with the ocean front instead of the delux, i only used the jacuzzi tub once but it was great! But i would still get just the ocean front cuz the tub took away from space in the room, but other than that the room was clean, we had no problems with noise, it was great cuz on some nights we could hear the shows going on next door at the Royal Hawaiian but only if we opend the lanai doors. The service was wonderful, for exampl on one night we didnt know where to have dinner and hubby was feeling mexican, we just walked down to the concierge and she suggested a great out of the way mexican restaurant i think it was called CHa Cha Cha's we sat outside and it wasnt even crowded, the portions were huge too! We also used the service to rent a car, they even came to get us. The beach in front of the hotel was pretty crowded but we managed to find a spot, the area to the left is where you can arrange for a whole bunch of water sports, which we never go to do, but from what i could see, we had the best hotel on the beach, i really loved it, i thougth it was convenient and it served its purpose, also right in front is the famous Nahoku II which is a catemaran another thing we never got to do, hopefully next time! But i would definately suggest this hotel, it was clean and convenient to ALL, great views, great service, had Dukes Canoe Club right downstairs which is supposed to be a happenin bar but, there was nothing happenin when we were there, it was very slow. Hope u enjoyed the review, please contact me with any questions!

reviews.text: We spent a week at this hotel. We got the ocean view room with breakfast.
reviews.title: Great Place!

Everything is basically within walking distance. There are plenty of restaurants, bars, shopping and even the international market across the street where you can buy hawaiian handcraft.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: We had reservations for 5 nights at this hotel, and had to move after only 2 nights. The walls are paper-thin, and you can hear the people in the next room talking. If the TV is on then the noise is worse.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, but very noisy rooms

reviews.title: A Good Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed here between 13th Oct and 17th Oct. After travelling for 16 days across the USA, ie, Anaheim,Las Vegas & New York, we were ready for some rest and relaxation and that is what we got. The room was great with partial ocean views and city views even though we'd only paid for city views. Big enough and confortable for my husband, daughter and me. Right across from the International Market Place and close to any shop or bus stop or anything you wanted. Dukes was fantastic, we had breakfast there every morning and also dinner once.
reviews.title: Loved it all!
Vegas on the Beach
reviews.text: If you're in your 20s and love to party or your a bigtime shopper who loves to spend spend spend; you'll love Waikiki. Families or plus 40 couples or friends will be less inspired. That's not to say the Outrigger isn't a really great hotel. It is and its located right in the heart of Waikiki/ The rooms are clean, the bathrooms feature limestone-marble-like tile surfaces and modern fixtures, the sound proofing is pretty darn good—unless you leave your sliding door open to hear the surf (which you can hear even in the 11th floor rooms). The beach tends to throb late into the night, so if you're trying to stay on PST or MST (which means hitting the bed at 8Pm and getting up at 4:30AM) you'll have to wear earplugs. The housekeeping staff is really great about helping out. The Hula Grill offers excellent breakfasts, great beachside views and fairly decent prices for a hotel on the beach! The prices at Duke's, below on the beach, are pretty expensive for what you get. (side bar: Foods pretty good but about what you expect. In fact,most of the food in Honolulu at the restaurants is just so-so. Stay out of the Chinese restaurants. They're wretched. I hit three before I swore them off. Japanese is the way to go). Also, be sure to checkout the historical/art exhibits near the Outrigger canoe in the OW's lobby! It offer priceless insight into Hawaiian culture. The swimming pool features sparkling clear salt water instead of chlorine. A huge plus. You can use your room card to get towels down there. But you probably won't use it if you came for the ocean....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: If you're tempted to take any of the gazillion catamaran cruises available on the beach out for snorkeling, forgettaboutit. They're a joke. They take you out about 300 yards, shamelessly chum for fish with cookies, and drop you in the middle of it all. Sure you see a few fish but you also fight currents and waves and the number of fish is about three species total, and maybe a turtle or two (swimming away from you as quickly as possible). Then afterwards they take you out into the ocean for a hour long out and back cruise to nowhere. It's a yawner, unless you were really dying to see the cityscape views of Honolulu.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: The Outrigger's new Plantation Spa is fantastic...just opened on the top floor; the prices are reasonable, the therapists highly skilled and the serene atmosphere is amazing with ocean views straight out to the horizon. I'd love to sit out in the rooftop hottubs in thevening! The very large couples massage room is extraordinary for the spa world, and the treatments and atmosphere will blow you away. The changing rooms feature a modern Hawaiian aesthethic.This is a spa treat worth considering if you plan to stay at the OW. Be sure to ask for a room near the express elevator so you can walk out of your room and take a direct lift to the spa (which is also next to a really great exercise room with all the modern cardio equipment).
reviews.title: Not what I expected for the price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2004
reviews.text: The biggest drawback to staying at the OW, and its true for many of the hotels on this strip, is that you pay a premium for parking. $18 a day plus tips. Even if you have a fly-car-stay package. Better idea: Take Speedy Shuttle from the airport and use the downtown shuttles to get around to Pearl Harbor or even around the island. For $2 per stop you can go all the way to Halaweia and Kanehoe or Hanauma Bay and back to Waikiki.
reviews.title: 20th anniversary
Great Location
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Outrigger Waikiki at the end of May 2006 for 5 days on our Honeymoon. The hotel was really nice and the staff were polite & helpful. We were sent a bottle of champagne to celebrate our honeymoon, which was a nice touch. I loved the view from our partial ocean view room - we could watch the beach and the street performers on the street at night. Duke's Restaurant downstairs and the Cheesecake Factory next door are both really good places to eat. Definately try Duke's buffet breakfast - the best buffet I've ever had! My only complaints are the tiny gym (however I hear they are doing construction right now building a much better one) and the ever-present time-share sellers. We got 2 tickets to a nice Luau for listening to a time-share presentation, but that took 4 hours!! Yikes! Highly recommended.
