reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff are very friendly and do their best to accommodate you at a very busy time of year.
reviews.title: We loved the Outrgger Waikiki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The location I don't think could be better, on the beach and near all the shops and restaurants. Beach services are good if a little on the expensive.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Waikik - Family Friendly

likes.liked: — Staff was very accomodating and location location location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the 16th floor with a partial sea view, very nice thank you. I agree with some of the the other reviews when they talk about the thin walls. We could hear people chatting as they passed our room and it goes with out saying they must have been able to hear us. Never was a problem at night and we slept soundly in comfortable beds every night. The room was large, well furnished and thoroughly cleaned daily.
reviews.title: busy, busy, busy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Cheesecake Factory is virtually next door but like all of them, very busy. The hotel has very good restaurants and bars for all meals. The breakfast buffet is particularly good.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Outrigger Waikiki on the Beach from Oct 25th to Nov 3rd 2007. There were initally problems with our reservation, we were to get a room with a King size bed, but they could not provide us with that so they gave us a free upgrade to an Oceanview room. The hotel is very clean, and very secure. A security feature that I really liked was you have to use your room key to go up in the elevator. Anyone can go down in the elevator to the common floors but to go to the guest areas you had to use your room key. I would suggest that they extend their checkout time to match your flight times. We had to check out at Noon, and we were not getting picked up to return to the airport until 7:45 PM. While they did store our luggage for it would have been nice to keep the room until about 5 pm, especially since we did not check in until 5 pm the day we arrived due to a mid afternoon flight arrival. We did inquire about keeping the room until 5 PM and they wanted to charge us an additional $180 for 4 hours, which is outrageous. All in all I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Oahu, it is a great hotel, with great service
reviews.title: Aloha

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: After noticing the Outrigger reef was under renovations and needing a stopover hotel for 2 nights after a 5 week trip through Canada and the US i chose the Outrigger Waikiki.
reviews.title: The spirit of Aloha is well alive here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As soon as i arrived by shuttle the bellman took my bags and i was greeted personally by a man who presented me with a lei, checked his clipboard to tell me they had my reservation on record and then directed me to the Check In Desk.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel!

likes.liked: — The spaciousness of the room and the tropical decor. Loved everything about the hotel!
likes.disliked: — Our room had partial ocean view, but also looked right into the rooms of the adjacent hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: As someone said you sit down to check in which is a nice touch and a little different as that's the first hotel i've been too that does that.
reviews.title: Great hotel for all travelers
It is what it Is
reviews.text: The check in agent offered me a room upgrade from a city view to a full ocean view as part of a "Deal" they had. I decided to go for it and ended up with Full Ocean View on the 15th floor for an extra $300 US for the 2 nights i was there! I'm so glad i did that my room was wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: Read reviews before we went and I must say I was apprehensive. Boy I don't now where some of these folks stayed but our room was large, our bed comfortable and king size. The construction was only annoying during the day time working hours but who is at their hotel at that time. Much to much to see and do and if on the beach you don't hear it. We toured the Island, shopped and ate out way through the Island. The people were friendly and we were very comfortable asking any question we had. Okay the bathroom was a little small but two average sized people could shower together. We had no problem with mold in our shower area. I was expecting black all over the place. They must have been much to picky or in the older part. The food was excellent and on our second morning at breakfast we ran into people form our home town that live 3 blocks from us. It's a small world. After all the construction is completed this is going to be the place to go and stay. More than it already is. We are hoping to go back soon. Our humidity here is so bad I miss the freshness of the Islands. And those rain showers were just little mist drop falling from the sky. When you looked up into the sky the sun reflecting they looked lke little diamonds or may be these are really the tears of Pele....
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005
reviews.text: July 1 - July 8th Loved it loved it loved it.
reviews.title: Loved Outrigger, Great Location, Try Dukes Canoe Club
Great Vacation
reviews.text: Indiana

reviews.title: We highly recommend the Outrigger on the Beach!
reviews.text: This was a great hotel, perfect location and good amenities at a reasonable price. Duke's canoe club inside the hotel is great for lunch and drinks at any time during the day. If you go, try the crab and macadamia nut won tons and the chicken quesadillas. Rooms were clean and nicely appointed. Outrigger is located in the middle of the main strip of hotels, so within walking distance of good shopping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005
reviews.text: I selected this hotel based on the reviews I read. It's location is great! Right in the middle of the action. This is great when your traveling with two teenagers. However if your looking for tranquility and no noise then select another Island not another hotel. Most of them are right on the strip, at least the nicer ones. The International Market is right across the street along with Macy's a whole bunch of designer stores and a lot of other stores. Lots of Restaurant too! You don't need a car but we did rent one. We used it almost everydate. Parking is expensive $18/day. The hotel staff is very friendly and always willing to help. My only negative comment would be the noise you can hear outside of your room. They need doors that are soundproof. Other reviews had indicated noise heard from the walls but that's not what I experienced. Couldn't hear anyone from the adjoining rooms. Only heard noise from the hallway. Room was fine. We were four in total and were fine with just one room. The room had two double beds and a pullout sofa. Our City view room had a partial view of the ocean. I wouldn't pay for ocean view. If that's what you want just go to the deck or the beach. Note: if you can get a room from the 14th floor and above it's the way to go. Floors 14 and above have a separate elevator. You won't have to deal with the issues other reviewers have mentioned (waiting a long time for an elevatior). For security purposes the elevators do not stop on the lower level after 10 pm. Security roams the floors too. I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Good for older folks too

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When booking this hotel back in Australia I was told by my travel agent that there would definitely be sun shelters around the pool. Well there is there is actually 4 sunbeds out of all of them that thanks to a couple of palm trees actually stay in the shade all day!. When you have paid $400 a night for a room, i don't except to then have to pay an extra $50 a day to get a sun shelter, which is available for hire on the beach. Obviously guests getting sunburnt is not of any concern to the hotel.. I will definitely not be staying here again.
reviews.title: No Sun Shelters

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband surprised me with a stay at the outrigger. We had a deluxe oceanfront with jacuzzi on the 12 th floor. The rooms are average in size but have been newly renovated with upscale features. The view was spectacular....we could view the azure v
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Blue water, watch the outriggers, surfers and even see the sea turtles in the water. We had breakfasts at Dukes and the Hula grille, both very nice. Get reservations to Dukes as it is a happening place. the staff, especially the valets were so very helpful. If you want a hotel with a big pool area, choice the Hilton Hawaiian as this one is rather small for the size of the hotel.
reviews.title: Met all of our expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Wonderful team, sensational property in the best location on Waikiki Beach. Great restaurants, lovely pool and really helpful tour desk team. The rooms are kept absolutely spotless and the housekeeping team do all they can to make you feel welcome at all times. Highly recommend this property to all. The ocean front rooms are worth the extra cost, the views are incredible! We will be back!
reviews.title: Good hotel in Waikiki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: The staff was so friendly! They were all very helpful. The location is awesome- close to restaurants, shopping, and the beach! There is surfing, stand up paddle boarding, catamarans, tubes, floats, umbrellas and chairs on the beach. It kind of stinks that you have to pay for chairs and umbrellas even though you're staying at the hotel. The restaurant in the hotel was good, I had lunch there and it was delicious. There was live music in the afternoon and everyone was up dancing and having a great time.
reviews.title: Not the most modern hotel on the strip, but still has it all.
Perfect choice!
reviews.text: Well, after reading many reviews on this site( and others) we decided to stay at the Outrigger on the Beach, from Nov. 24- Dec2.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We wanted beach front, good location, nice clean rooms , restaurant choices and a nice view. All that for less then 200 dollars a night.
reviews.title: Loved It!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got it at the Outrigger on the Beach. We paid 198. and got breakfast thrown in also. Great deal, the breakfast buffet was definately excellant, made on the spot omelettes, fresh fruit, yogurts, granola, fresh baked goods, french toast( very good) waffles with warm strawberry syrup( filled with strawberries!) bacon, sausages( two kinds) eggs, eggs benedicts, etc, etc, . We had breakfast there 7 days in a row and never got bored!
reviews.title: oh, the sunsets!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had room 1220, which we loved, not ocean front, but full ocean view, it was clean, had two double beds, and a sofa, plus a desk and a decent sized bathroom( only a half tub though, but we never use the tub on vacation, just shower) Mini fridge, iron and board, hair dryer, and safe (free) all in room also. Lots of closet space. We recomment staying on a higher floor just to avoid any noise , we think anthing about 8 or 9 would be fine.
reviews.title: Lots of problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We requested and got, a room facing Diamond head, thank goodness as the rooms on the other side get awful noise from a roof fan on the Cheescake Factory. We could leave our door open at night and hear the waves crashing!
reviews.title: Excellent time

likes.disliked: — Thin connecting door to next room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon from June 18 - June 23 and had a great time. Our room was on the 4th floor with a partial view of the beach and has the perfect location. Right across the street from the International Market Place, right on the beach, easy walking distance for dinner or souvenirs. The Outrigger has so many stores within its complex, you really do need to go far for anything. We ate at Duke's and the Hula Grill and both were excellent. Other places we liked for dinner were The Cheesecake Factory and Nick's Fishmarket. Try the Mac Nut Crusted Mahi Mahi. For a cheap breakfast, try Keoni's and the Seaside Bar and Grill for under $3.00. You won't be disappointed with this resort.
reviews.title: Excellent Resort

likes.liked: — Right on the beach in Waikiki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007
reviews.text: We stayed at the Outrigger Waikki for 3 nights of our honeymoon in June, 2007. It was our first three nights in Hawaii, so I splurged on an Oceanfront room with a jacuzzi. Much more than I would normally spend, so was expecting something special. Overall pretty pleased, but there are definitely better values out there (we used Hotwire later to stay at the Waikki Parc and enjoyed that too, for far less.)
reviews.title: Great stay overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007
reviews.text: Upon arriving after 10 hours of traveling, the staff was great. The valet took the car, bellhops grabbed the bags, and we checked in pretty quickly despite some computer issues. Our impression of the staff overall was very positive, including their quickly delivering a suprise gift from friends.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on the 13th floor (which has a handy express elavator for the top couple floors). The room was nice, with a king-sized bed, desk, and great view. The bathroom is large, has marble counters and was comfortable. The jacuzzi has funky sliding doors that can make it part of the bathroom or part of the room. The lanai had 2 chairs & a small table, and a great view. Not a huge room, but very comfortable.
reviews.title: great location right on Waikiki Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They room cleaners always did a very good job, and the turndown service / additional tidying was helpful, considering how much sand we tracked with us.
reviews.title: A bit dated.

likes.liked: — Large room and right on the beach
likes.disliked: — noisy and a bit 'in your face'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in an Ocean View room at the Outrigger Waikiki on the Beach and this place was excellent. The room was very spacious, clean and a nice view of the beach and Diamond Crater from the small balcony. No noise issues at all. Very happy, friendly and helpful staff. Duke's bar a great place to sit and relax with a drink or two at the end of the day, listen to the entertainment and watch the sunset. Hula Grill - great meals and fantastic atmosphere.The location of the hotel is perfect, across the road from the International Marketplace and close to all the trolley's pickups and shops galore and of course the beach is right on your doorstep or relax around the pool. Very impressed with this hotel and would highly recommend. Mahalo Outrigger Waikiki on the Beach!!!.............Kel and Helen
reviews.title: Outrigger Waikiki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wife booked a Deluxe Ocean Front-One Bedroom Suite for just the two of us. The difference between the Ocean Front Suite and the Deluxe Ocean Front Suite is that the deluxe model is on the Diamond Head side of the property providing an outstanding view of not only Waikiki but Diamond Head too! We think that the Diamond Head side is worth the extra cost.
reviews.title: Best Room at Outrigger Waikiki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The living room, bedroom, and two (yes two) baths were appointed nicely. And, one of my big things, we had a clean, comfortable bed.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Staff was very friendly, helpful and the service was super from the Front Desk (check-in/check-out), housekeeping, and Bellmen. We tried the Hula Grill for breakfast on our first morning and was very pleased. I had my first "Loco Moco" Breakfast - try it if you haven't already. Duke's is also a good place to eat. We didn't have a chance to eat there this time but have been there before while staying at another hotel. If you like chocolate and ice cream, be sure to try a "Hula Pie" at Duke's - YUMMY!
reviews.title: Great Location and Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Travel Desk was very helpful too, but be careful of the offer to have $100 knocked off your activities for spending a couple of hours in a time-share presentation - unless you like time shares- or you and your spouse can resist the sales pitch and think that the hundred bucks is worth your while. It's not billed as a time share presentation, but that's what it is. When you've been around for a while you know how to say No, but I am concerned about the younger folks that haven't been bitten yet. Unfortunately, this goes on most everywhere now.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just returned from a 9 night stay at the Outrigger Waikiki.
reviews.title: Never, ever again

likes.disliked: — walls so noisy, it didn't matter what the bed was like

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main problem was noise in the walls...it was really bad. Anytime someone flushes the toilet, you can hear it in a very loud cascade of watery pipes in the wall. Enough to wake you up, which happened a lot throughout the night, every night. Bring ear plugs. Even my husband was awakened, and he is a very heavy sleeper. It doesn't matter where the hotel is, if you can't get a good night's sleep. This is the noisest hotel I have ever been to, ever. When I commented to the concierge, he merely laughed and told me the hotel has the best location.
reviews.title: Absolutely Superb in every way!!

likes.disliked: — Pool area could be slightly bigger, but you have the beach on your door step who wants the pool!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: I also felt lied to about the room. We purchased an "ocean view" room. I am posting photos of this "view". Upon looking out the window, all we could see was the next door hotel. You have to actually lean out over the rail to get the promised ocean view. The lanai is small and situated so that only one person can ever see the view. If it had been billed as partial ocean view and priced accordingly, I would not have been miffed. We purposely booked a room for ocean view, and feel that Outrigger misled.
reviews.title: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room itself was very nice, and the bedding comfortable. Housekeeping was ok...we did not get toilet paper restocked on 3 days and had to call twice when we ran out.
reviews.title: Almost above average overall, but You need to be quiet in your own room

likes.disliked: — Thin walls, can hear the noise from the outside even with the doors closed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Where do I start about this hotel, awful, awful, awful! I cant believe how many good reviews it has to be honest, I thought it should be rated 2/3*. I had been informed that the hotel had recently been modified, but I dont know where exactly.
reviews.title: Dont stay here if you want a nice holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We traveled to Hawaii for our honeymoon, stopping at Las Vegas on the way to Hawaii staying in the Bellagio, I dont know whether we were comparing this hotel to the Bellagio, but after feeling like royalty there when we got to our room in the Outrigger it seemed like a hostel compared to the Bellagio.
reviews.title: Great location, starting to look a bit tired
Best Anniversary Stay
reviews.text: At check in we were waiting around for a while until a desk was available, we were told we had a room upgrade from a partial ocean view room to a full ocean view room, which we were pleased about.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we got to our room we were situated right out side the lift, so every morning and evening when people came back to their rooms we were woken up, it was sooooo noisy, the walls must be paper thin I have never stayed in a place quite like it. You can hear what everyone is up to in the rooms beside and above you and are woken every time someone flushes the toilet.
reviews.title: Loved it

likes.liked: — Ocean view, access to shopping, wonderful treatment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we entered our room we were so disappointed, the room was dated, shabby, the balcony had all paint peeling off it, the bathroom was just awful, with no light in the shower so you basically had to shower in darkness once you had pulled the shower curtain across. And so much for the full ocean view room it was still a partial oceanview room, we hadnt been upgraded at all. I did complain about this at reception but they basically said that they didn’t have another room for us, we could have upgraded to a full ocean suite but that was going to cost an extra $150 a night! We had already paid a fortune to stay in this hotel.
reviews.title: Outrigger Waikik on the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from HI and a stay at the Outrigger Waikiki. The hotel is in a very central Waikiki location. The International Marketplace is directly across the street and shopping and restaurants are all up and down Kalakaua Ave (the street the hotel is on). The beach is right outside your door and Dukes on the ground floor is always hopping. For a quieter time, try the Hula Grill, especially on Friday or Saturday night when they play Hawaiian music.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The beach although crowded is still wonderful-and you can't beat the warm Pacific. If you have little ones or are timid about the ocean, there is an area in front of the Royal Hawaiian hotel that is very shallow. Better yet, down the street there is a great beach park that has a storm wall and a very calm shallow pool.
reviews.title: Outrigger on the Beach is a good bet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: One of the highlights was seeing Aunty Genoa Keawe sing at the Moana Terrace on Thursday evening. She is consdiered the first lady of Hawaiian falsetto singing and at 87 can still hold a note for what seems like an impossibly long time-amazing.
reviews.title: Never Again!! Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Second time here, came back for our 20th. Very nice hotel with a perfect location, across from the International Market and next to all the surfing. The room (2 doubles) perfectly sized and the view was (ocean view Diamond Head) adequate. I would ask if you could be placed as high as possible and as close to the beach, it offers a better view.
reviews.title: Awesome location and view!

likes.liked: — Right on the beach, great views!
likes.disliked: — Some noise from people on the beach all night long!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The beauty of the Outrigger is the music. Dukes is their open air bar on the beach and every evening a band is playing island music which carries offshore. Sitting on their beach, watching the sunset, and listening to a band, nothing is better. If you want to try to learn to surf, walk over to the surfing area, the Outrigger lesson rates are a bit too high at $45/hour for a group lesson. Got a private lesson for $35 next door at the park.
reviews.title: Best Hotel on Waikiki!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in June for our belated honeymoon. We booked this last minute through their website. Their service from the start was great. They accomodated us when we had to ring and cancel the first night due to a delay caused by United at LAX. After 24hrs travelling time - they were very accomodating and tried to get our room available as soon as possible. We were upgraded to a ocean view which was unexpected surprise. The little touches like the newsletter with the individual welcome was a nice. The guest excursion services were very helpful and knowledgeable. The location of the hotel was very central and right on the beach. The hotel guests were a real mix from families, teenagers, couples and hooneymooners.
reviews.title: Loved it - all smiles and great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You don't need to to do car rental as you can get around most of the sights (Pearl Harbor, Diamond head) by the BUS. We only rented a car for 1 day to explore the north of the island. Don't miss out on the other beaches and shaved ice.
reviews.title: Exactly As Advertised
Great!!
reviews.text: We would highly recommend the Paradise Cove Luau.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Also a must for breakfast is Eggs & things.
reviews.title: Great location in the Heart of Paradise

likes.disliked: — Condition of room on my arrival

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate at the hula Grill on our last night and the food was great!!
reviews.title: Costa Del Hawaii

likes.disliked: — The lifts were very poor, and took ages to arrive even late at night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was aggravating because they do not have a normal desk. They have desk clerks seated far apart from each other at a very long desk. This resulted in confusion when checking in. One man sailed past a line of 3 parties with luggage waiting to check in, straight to the clerk who had just came available. I figured he did not see us all standing here and I politely (I promise, politely!) stated that there were 3 different groups of us there waiting. He proceeded to insult me. The hotel staff did nothing and he was waited on ahead of the line.
reviews.title: Great experience at the Outrigger Waikiki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: November 6, 2008
reviews.title: Fabulous Time at the Outrigger Waikiki

likes.liked: — The hotel in general, location and wonderful staff.
likes.disliked: — The partial ocean view room with the noisy air condition at the Cheesecake Factory

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: My husband and I spent four wonderful days and nights at the Outrigger Waikiki last month. The hotel was beautiful and clean with a great room. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous. Can't say enough about it! Duke's Restaurant is also a great place to dine as is the Hula Grill with the beautiful view - especially for breakfast when it is nice and quiet on the beach. Our only disappoint was we had a partial ocean view and we really could not sit on the porch without hearing the loud air conditioner from the Cheesecake Factory - we didn't spend that much time in our room but when we did want to sit out at night it is quite noisy. We were celebrating our 40th wedding anniversary and renewed our vows at the Outrigger Reef which I would recommend to anyone going there for an anniversary. A beautiful ceremony on the beach - we even had a rainbow! All in all a beautiful time in a great hotel. We went on to Maui after Oahu and found it to be a much more relaxed island without all of the shopping and traffic of Oahu. However, still had a wonderful time!
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at this resort 10/26 – 10/30/08. Here is our view of the hotel.
reviews.title: A great hotel - right on the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: CHECK-IN: Super easy & fast. When you pull up to the curb in front of the hotel, the bell hops will meet you, tag your bags, get your name and advise you to proceed to the lobby. Once you walk into the lobby, they call you by name right away to come and sit down for check-in. Only took a few minutes. We booked a city view room (cheapest) and were told at check-in we were getting a free upgrade to a partial ocean view since we had previously stayed at an Outrigger resort. I had emailed the hotel a few weeks before arrival and asked that we be put on one of the top floors and also on the opposite side of the Cheesecake Factory fans based on all the reviews I had read. They replied back that they couldn’t guarantee it but all rooms are assigned the day before arrival. We were pleased that our requests were honored. We were on the 14th floor, opposite side of the Cheesecake Factory. Also very pleased to be away from the elevators and the ice machine. Our view from our balcony was nice. I’ve attached a picture.
reviews.title: Nice rooms, beautiful beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOM: Nice and roomy enough for 2 people. We requested and had 2 double beds. There was also a sofa and desk, which served as our bar. There was a nice large walk-in type closet off the bathroom vanity area. Also another closet in the hallway with sliding doors that had full length mirrors on them. The shower and toilet were separated from the vanity area by a sliding door. Small tub, which would only be big enough to bath a small child but that didn’t bother us as we are shower people. Vanity is good sized, nice granite counter top but not very well lit, as some have mentioned. You also have a large safe, mini-fridge that is rather good sized for a hotel, hair dryer, coffee maker, etc. Some reviews have said the décor is dated. I didn’t think so at all. It’s tropical. You’re in Hawaii, what would one expect? The A/C worked well but you need to shut your lanai sliding door in order to get it to come on.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely hotel, GREAT staff, terrific restaurants, and what a location! BUT, if you want to sleep on your vacation...this property is not a good choice. Walls are paper-thin between rooms and you can hear EVERYTHING going on in the adjoining rooms (on either side, and above). After reporting concerns to the front desk they said we had to call them as soon as we heard the noises (which were more or less non-stop) and they would send Security to investigate...not really something we want to become involved/engaged in during our vacation. People in other rooms were not being that unreasonable...the hotel just needs to do something about soundproofing. There was also a gaggle of "musicians" making noise for donations directly in front of the International Marketplace (right across the road from this hotel). The drum, electric guitar and steel drum solos carried on until after 2:00 am, making it impossible to have a window open. We spoke with hotel security staff at the entrance and they said there was not really anything they could do about it. It was obvious that we were not the only ones being bothered as we witnessed others voicing similar complaints. I would think the surrounding hotels would be taking steps with the local authorities to establish some guidelines. We spoke with the police at the Waikiki Beach detachment and they had received similar complaints that same day. We live in the heart of downtown Vancouver in a condo and are not unreasonable about city noises, but between the poor sound proofing and the unregulated noise makers across the road we did not get one night of sleep in two weeks! So, if you are hoping to get any rest during your stay in Waikiki I would personally not recommend this otherwise lovely property.
reviews.title: Wonderful EXCEPT for the noise....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were extremely satisfied with the Hawaiian hospitality.
reviews.title: Loved the outrigger on the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was great the service fantastic We would stay there again and again
reviews.title: Great vacation

likes.liked: — Rooms were very well kept and up to date. Great Views!
likes.disliked: — thin walls, noisy housekeeping staff near the supply closet, noisy A/C unit at the hotel next door, timeshare people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is my second time staying at the OWB, after our stay 2 years ago we vowed we wouldn't stay anywhere else.So many great things about this hotel, free calls to USA and Canada for keeping in touch with family (this came in handy) booking activities, rental car, transportation etc through hotel, literally a one stop shop. I found that our hotel had the best restaurants in Waikiki Beach, we kept returning after walking the strip because nothing could really beat the views and the quality of food, Chucks, Dukes and Hula grill were fantastic, the store in the lobby came in handy as well with bottled water very reasonably priced and accessible near the beach and our room. My only disappointment this time were the thin walls, I never realized it as a much during our last stay but we were kept up at night with the sound of flushing toilets, people bathing, talking etc. we were situated right next to the maid supply closet and trust me they weren't quiet when speaking to each other. If you do stay here and realize you are in a room ending in "00" maybe request a room change, all the floors with "00" for (200, 300, 400) have the supply closet next to it which is accessible at all hours of the day by the janitorial staff, Also these same rooms overlook the roof of the Royal Hawaiian hotel that is undergoing a huge reno and their A/C fan is on the roof deck right outside of the "00" rooms and is extremely noisy . We mentioned this to the hotel staff and they quickly switched us into another oom, aside from the thin walls that all the rooms have, I was again a delited guest, service was great! Oh and another thing to be aware of is there is a pushy timeshare person offering discounts right next to the activities desk so be aware when booking an activity through the hotel that you may be bugged 1 second later by a timeshare rep telling you that they can give it to you for free if you attend a session of theirs. Which I found kinda unfair to the hotel activities sales people who were very helpful.
reviews.title: Outrigger fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Far exceeded our expectations. Was decorated for Christmas, very festive. All staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms very clean and quiet, and much bigger than expected. Was told we had a city view room when in fact our room had a great view of the ocean from our balcony. Great beach access. Dukes restaurant OK, LOVED Hula Grill!! Don't rent a car from the airport. Rent a car from hotel for the day. Don't need a car unless you want to explore the island. Will absolutely return in the future. Vancouver, WA
reviews.title: superb hotel for beach location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Outrigger Waikiki is a fantastic hotel. The position is superb, the staff are so friendly and certainly the best place to stay on Waikiki Beach. Umbrellas are lacking and should be available around the pool. We stayed there twice in the same month and both rooms on the 11th floor were fine.
reviews.title: Best location, amazing service and best value
Excellent location and service
reviews.text: My stay of10 nights at The Outrigger Waikiki on the Beach was wonderful! My Partial Ocean View room on the 14 th floor was very comfortable ,quiet and recently renovated. Staff are very helpful and cleaning was excellent! Best place to stay , right on the beach in Waikiki, good value , close to the best shops and restaurants such as Dukes and the Cheesecake Factory! I traveled with my elderly parents who were accommodated in the room next door , which was very convenient for us.They were very pleased with the hotel service and location. I will definitely be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Outrigger on the Beach Wakiki. On arrival we were told we in "luck" as we had been given a partial view room on 7th floor. I would hate to be unlucky. This room was very small with the word"partial" being appropriate. Room was overlooking the roof of the building next door and nothing but their generator could be heard all night.
reviews.title: Lucky for location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Went out onto to very small balcony, but far too noisy and back inside and closed the door.
reviews.title: Excellent value for the view and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only thing positive is the location, short walk to beach and to Duke's Restaurant.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband, son (19) and I just returned from Honolulu at the end of last week and had gone to Turtle Bay Resort for the first part of the trip and then decided to spend 3 nights in Waikiki at the Outrigger. We really enjoyed ourselves. The service was excellent in the resort as well as in Duke's, the restaurant, on the premises. We ate breakfast there one day, dinner their one night and lunches every day. You couldn't beat the ocean view from Duke's. Our room was a partial ocean view. It was fine except there wasn't a full bathtub--only a half-bath with shower. Everything was very well maintained but could do with a facelift. The lounges around the pool were a little tired and unfortunately there were no umbrellas around the pool if you wanted shade. You would have to rent them on the beach for $50U.S. The location on Waikiki Beach was perfect. Lots to look at in the evenings after dinner--shopping etc. One of the things we appreciated most about the Outrigger was that they gave us a room to shower and get ready for our late flight on our last day. We weren't flying out until 1:30 a.m. and had to check out in the morning so they stored our luggage and when we were ready to shower and leave they gave us a room for 30 minutes to get ready. This was wonderful. Would recommend this resort for those wanting to take in Waikiki Beach!
reviews.title: Really enjoyed it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, location is good if you want central Waikiki, but the following pitfalls would make us stay somewhere else next time:
reviews.title: Beware the pitfalls !

likes.disliked: — Quality of room (especially the noise factors)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: * Walls are paper thin (this is quite true). Could hear conversations next door).
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

likes.disliked: — Had to pay for beach chairs.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * Initial room with adjoining door let in a ridiculous amount of noise.
reviews.title: Perfect Oahu honeymoon hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * Rooms on Cheesecake Factory side do get a lot of noise from the outside aircon vents.
reviews.title: What a view!

likes.disliked: — a touch noisy from the entertainment below

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I booked the Outrigger for the majority of our honeymoon stay in Hawaii. Of course, we read many reviews on trip advisor before going, so we weren't sure exactly what to expect based on the mixed reviews.
reviews.title: Loved the Outrigger!

likes.disliked: — Sometimes we could hear noise from our neighbors...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a great time! The first 6 nights we stayed in a partial ocean view room with a king size bed. The room was spacious and the bathroom was very nice. However, being on the first floor, our view wasn't very good. We could see a little of the ocean, but mostly just the building next door. We liked the free in-room safe. The beds were very comfortable as well. The hotel also allows customers free calling anywhere in the U.S.! As honeymooners, there was a bottle of champage in our room the first night.
reviews.title: Completely positive experience!!

likes.liked: — location location location!! right on the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: After returning from a few days in Maui, we upgraded to a deluxe ocean front room, and it was definitely worth it! The room has a spa tub and a fabulous view of the ocean (obviously). The room is a bit smaller than the partial ocean view, but still worth it. If you can, upgrade to this room!
reviews.title: Excellent

likes.disliked: — Rooms a little tight but nothing major

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Maid service was excellent and the staff at the Outrigger was very helpful. We were amazed at how well they handle everyone's luggage with so many people coming and going. The staff was also great about moving our luggage during our stay in Maui. We didn't take all of our bags with us, and when we returned to the Outrigger, our luggage had already been moved for us into our new room.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Since I've read other reviews of the hotel, I know that some people complain about the walls being too thin. I was able to hear our neighbors several times, but the noise wasn't so much that we couldn't deal with it.
reviews.title: Can't beat the location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just completed a 1 week stay at the Outrigger Waikiki on the Beach and had a great time. All the staff were helpful and friendly. We enjoyed the coolers of ice water with lemon & lime that was available during the day in the lobby - nice touch. The staff & services were top notch. We arrived during the end of a winter wind / rain storm, which was an unusual event.
reviews.title: Great location & service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Restaurants: Dukes & the Hula Grill had to put up tarps to keep the wind & rain out of the restaurant, which was interesting, but not terrible. Not much you can do about the weather, you know? The tarps came down as soon as the weather cleared up.
reviews.title: Great location, relaxed but professional atmosphere

likes.liked: — clean, fridge, spacious; fab location; good food on site.
likes.disliked: — balcony noise and style; no late room service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had free breakfast at Dukes or Hula Grill included in our room price. Dukes had a good buffet - lots of choices and everything kept freshly stocked. At the Hula Grill we had our choice of items from the menu. The breakfast was good here too, but the service was lacking the one day we tried it for breakfast, so we just stuck with Dukes. We had dinner at Dukes once and Hula Grill twice - we actually preferred the Hula Grill over Dukes for the atmosphere and view (and the service was wonderful at dinner). All the pigeons running around and flying around Dukes were a bit unnerving. Especially when they flew & landed on the table (yuck!). We put up with the birds during breakfast , but twice in one day was too much. I guess they were part of the atmosphere (?). The food was excellent in both restaurants.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our room was on an upper floor with a partial ocean view . We enjoyed sitting on the patio & taking in the sights. The rooms on that side of the hotel (at least on our floor) are rectangular shaped and a bit smaller than the angled rooms across the hall, but our room was adequate for the 2 of us. It had so much closet space and dresser drawers! We did talk to a man who had a room across the hall, right behind the elevators. He said there was no noise from the elevators at all, but he could hear the fans from the Cheesecake Factory next door. This surprised us, as we were at such a high floor. I do wish there was more light in the dressing area of the bathroom. The lighting is all over the vanity area, and it is dark looking into the closet, and also hard to see if you style your hair & turn your back to the vanity to use a hand mirror to see the back of your head! Housekeeping kept the room tidy & clean, which was nice. We did hear faint noise occasionally (not even daily) from our neighbors and even from the street performers across from the hotel at night, but I think I only noticed because of reviews I had read that said the hotel was very noisy. Although the rooms aren't completely soundproof, we didn't think it was too bad at all.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel!

likes.liked: — Room was beautiful and very clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't rent a car, so we didn't have to experience the parking fees. We did enjoy the central location of the hotel - so easy to get anywhere we wanted to go! We had a late evening flight home, so we were able to have a late checkout (only 1 extra hour, but better than nothing) and we were able to use a courtesy room to clean up a bit before our trip home. That was a huge plus in our book! We would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Spent 3 wonderful days at the Outrigger. When we entered the hotel, we were immediately approached by a very pleasant greeter who led us to chairs to be checked in by another equally pleasant clerk. The people at the Outrigger are well trained in hotel hospitality. Being treated well is as important to me as the cleanliness of the rooms, which by the way were spotlessly clean and beautiful. My room was very large, with large mirrors making it feel even bigger. Although the rooms looked nice online...they are even better in reality! I always use tripadvisor reviews to choose hotels, and so had mixed feelings about this hotel as many reported being disturbed by other guests because of too thin walls. This never happened to me...phew. I must say however, that my room faced the fans of the Cheesecake factory and this noise is not pleasant. However, I would recommend this hotel, but advise others to ask for rooms on the opposite side of the building....and suggest that the Outrigger might want to pay for some sort of noise barrier for roof with the offending noise. All rooms have balonies with chairs and you can see the ocean from each. Went to the hotel bar, Dukes, which is right on the beach and found a very friendly bartender and a fun atmosphere. Had dinner there one night and it was delicious (again, I expected just ok food and was pleasantly surprised by the fresh well cooked fish of the day). They also have an extensive salad bar and Hawaiian wandering singers. This hotel is so welcoming that it made the noisy fan over the cheesecake factory bearable. I liked it better than the fancy resort we stayed in on the north shore of Oahu, although that resort was beautiful, the staff were neither helpful nor friendly.
reviews.title: Great Hotel with Very Friendly Staff

likes.liked: — Right on the beach, friendly staff, nice room, balony overlooking the sea, resonable rates
likes.disliked: — Noisy fan from Cheesecake Factory next door.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Just returned form our first trip to Honolulu, and stayed at the outrigger waikiki on the beach.. It was wonderful. The staff was all very polite and helpful, from the housecleaning and bell boys, to the staff at Duke's. There were 20 of us who went and we all got the rooms we had requested, with 2 doubles and a pull out couch. We requested a microwave and received it within 2 hours of checking in, and there was no extra charge for it. They had backpacks and sunglasses for the kids. They also gave us a late check out for 8 p.m. for a minimal charge, and even moved one of us to another room for that day because the other room was booked. We had a city view room but we had a great view of the ocean. Watched the fireworks over the ocean from our room on New Years eve, which was perfect because our kids were in bed sleeping. The hotel was great with the kids. The lobby bathrooms were always clean, so you didn't have to go up to the room from the beach with the kids to go to the bathroom. The pool was deep for little kids, but the sand and beach area in front of the hotel, I think is the best spot on Waikiki. There were two boats right in front of the hotel you could go on for $25 for 1.5 hrs, that includes drinks. The hotel is also right in front of the International Marketplace,could go shopping any time we wanted.The prices in Duke's restaurant and bar, were very reasonable also. A great seafood dinner, with salad bar and fresh ceasar salad for $20. All in all, it was great, and I will definitly go back.
reviews.title: loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The location of this hotel just can't be beat! It's literally right in the middle of everything, and the beach access is fantastic. The room itself was pretty standard, but nothing really to complain too much about. The free breakfast buffet every morning was delicious, although it was the same food every single day...
reviews.title: Best Location!

likes.disliked: — Maid service was a little slow...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Hawaii, and we were both glad we chose this place over all the others.
reviews.title: Loooooved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: All in all, I would definitely recommend this hotel. (Personally, I would rather save some money and stay at a hotel not on the beach.)
reviews.title: Loved the Outrigger Waikiki

likes.liked: — The friendly staff and out view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want tranquillity or natural unspoilt beach, don’t come to Waikiki; go to one of the other islands, where there are plenty of quiet and beautiful beaches and mountains, great surf and scenery, and not too many people.
reviews.title: The Classic and Quintessential Waikiki Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you come to Waikiki expect a city on the beach, a party on the sand where skyscrapers meet the ocean and there are people: eating, drinking, sunbathing, surfing, swimming in the ocean, listening to bands, and doing whatever makes a vacation. It’s classy in places, a bit trashy in others, but it has a unique style of its own, based on sun, sea, surf and the Hawaiian culture. Personally, I think it is great.
reviews.title: Fantastic Holiday Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at a few Waikiki hotels, but a September break in this Outrigger has been one of the best. We got a 14th floor room with ocean view on two sides, and the view was spectacular. The hotel has three restaurants inside, all good: A great Steakhouse, an upscale seafood restaurant and not forgetting the famous Duke’s Barefoot Bar and Grill, named after Duke Kahanamoku, one of the founding fathers of modern surfing. He is certainly well remembered and loved, with a statue of him on Kalakaua Ave by the ocean.
reviews.title: Perfect Location
Great location
reviews.text: Our one bed suite was spacious, if traditionally furnished. The atmosphere was great, and you had the feel of being right in the action, or above it, with easy access to the pool, beach, shops, the sunset rock band and more.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you like Waikiki you should like this place. I would certainly come back here.
reviews.title: Redecoration? really?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Hotel is very nice. Bellhops waiting outside for baggage when we arrived around 1130 at night after a long flight from the mainland! Check in was a breeze with the individual chairs. Had a room with a King size bed and sofa bed. Plenty of space in the rooms. Bathrooms are amazing. Marble countertops, new fixtures etc. Large closet with safe. We had an onceanview room, which was fantastic. Enjoyed watching the catamarans and surfers in the morning and evening from the lanai. Beach was crowded, but well it's Waikiki enjoy yourself! Try and take your own beach chairs if you can fit them. They cost about $10 a day to rent. Gets expensive. Very convenient location. International Marketplace and mall are right next door. Also convenient to tour bus pick ups (Koa Street). All in all, can't wait. If i ever get the chance to return, would probably stay somewhere else, just to stay somewhere else. would definitely reccoment this hotel. very nice!
reviews.title: Loved It. Want To Go Back NOW!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Outrigger Waikiki on the Beach for the first two nights of our Honeymoon in Hawaii. You can't beat the location - right in the middle of everything! We were able to get outrigger canoe rides and a boat cruise right in front of the hotel. And the service was really top notch. We had a partial oceanview room, and I thought the view was decent and worth the upgrade. (See picture.)
reviews.title: Great location and service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, we were very happy - it's a very nice place!
reviews.title: First floor fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked an Oceanview though the travel agent and were offered an upgrade to Oceanfront balcony for $90 additional. Glad we accepted the upgrade. Our room was #127 and all the balconies on this floor are larger because they are over the patio restaurant roof and practically on the beach. Thankfully, there was very little noise from the restaurant. The band played on the patio from 4:00 - 6:00 both nights which were Saturday and Sunday. Don't know if the band plays during the week though.
reviews.title: Divine Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are non-smoking with comfortable beds and fridge. Large shower but no bathtub. Separate sink and make up room with plenty of hangars and a safe. Unlimited long distance calls to the Mainland and Canada was a great feature. Spirits available in the giftshop downstairs.
reviews.title: a 3 star hotel at best

likes.liked: — the view sitting whether yoiu are sitting at duke's , chuck's or the hula grill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and booked the Outrigger because we wanted to stay at a hotel that was centrally located and right on the beach. We had also read many great reviews of the hotel on this website so we figured we couldn't go wrong.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Upon arriving to the hotel we were greeted by a very friendly lady named Jan. Unfortunately, she ended up being the best part of the hotel. Jan informed us that we would be staying on the first floor in a room with a queen bed. Upon booking the hotel in May, we had requested a king bed on a higher floor. I do realize that requests are sometimes not possible, but I figured that they should at least be able to try and accomodate one of them. We said that the queen bed was no problem, but did they have something on a higher floor? She looked in the computer and eventually found us a room on the top floor with a queen bed. We headed up to the room and were extremely disappointed. The room was the most awkward shape. The bed was in a corner up against a wall and did not face the TV which was on the opposite side of the room. The bathroom was tiny and I could barely fit in it. The decor of the room seemed outdated and everything felt old. The balcony was very tiny and seemed somewhat unsafe. We went back down to the reception and asked Jan if there were any other rooms available. She then put us in another queen room on the 12th floor which she assured us we would be more happy with. This room was not much better. The bathroom was bigger, but the tub was half the size of a normal tub and the floor was dirty. I also lifted up the toilet lid to go to the bathroom and found urine all over the seat! We ended up staying just one night at this hotel and we checked out the very next day. They did not penalize us for leaving early and just charged us for one night. Before we left I checked out the pool. It was very small and not private at all. Anyone walking on the beach could have gained access to the pool as there were steps leading up to it from the beach.
reviews.title: Avoid this hotel rip off

likes.disliked: — Reception and badly insulated rooms - very noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this hotel. There are far nicer hotels just minutes away from the beach that are still reasonably priced. We checked into the Hilton Prince Kuhio wihich was a hundred times better than the Outrigger. It is newly renovated and each room has a huge bathroom and a 42 inch plasma TV!!
reviews.title: Great hotel, beware of what you get for an 'ocean view' room

likes.disliked: — noise of cheeskcake factory fans, in our room before we got upgraded

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I am writing this from our hotel room just before check out as free hi-speed internet is one of the best services of this supposedly deluxe hotel - along with its unbeatable location on Waikiki Beach. We have been here 4 nights and the free internet and convenience of walking downstairs onto the beach are not adequate compensation for the terrible check-in experience we suffered - where the hotel "held us hostage" to higher rates than those quoted by phone & email with a snooty manager who when we protested suggested we might look for "less expensive rooms" elsewhere - as we checked in after having reserved back in May 2007 - Plus the paper-thin walls between our "partial ocean view" room (if you go out on the 4-foot balcony on the first floor - any hotel's worst floor as we know from many international travels) and the juvenile party goers next door... Every time the toilet flushes anywhere near us the noise is like a small freight train next to the beds,,. At least the kids quieted down when I phoned their room at 11 pm and politely asked them to be a bit more quiet.
reviews.title: Great hotel - location, location, location

likes.liked: — The location is close to everything
likes.disliked: — The balcony of our room seemed unsafe

reviews.title: Honeymoon in Waikiki
reviews.text: Anyway, you get the picture. We reserved with local Hawaiian friends for a dozen people in May and on arrival we got the worst service I've experienced; the worst floor in the hotel; a very noisy hotel that seems to cater more to the "younger crowd" (ie 20 somethings) - which would be fine if the rooms were adequately insulated: 4 of our rooms complained to me about this... for a deluxe price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was a bit reluctant over this hotel. It was the first stop for 3 nights on our honeymoon but I cannot praise the hotel enough.
reviews.title: Wonderful in Waikiki
Outrigger the best hotel on Waikiki for location and price
reviews.text: We booked a partial ocean view but managed to upgrade at a cheaper rate when we checked in to an ocean front room and boy was it worth it (see the pics!). The view was amazing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I realise that some people had trouble with thin walls/noisy rooms but I have to say that at one point I thought the rooms next to us weren't occupied until I physically saw people coming and going....we didn't hear a peep! We were on the 14th floor though and I know Lonely Planets review of this hotel said to get a room on the upper floors for the best views and the 'quietest' digs.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel with small beach and poor soundproofing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only ate at Dukes the once - it was pleasant enough, plenty of choice.
reviews.title: Amazing Hawaii

likes.liked: — Large rooms with plenty of space on balcony
likes.disliked: — Next to the ice machine and not getting a good view .. view of bins!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is superb, right in the centre of Waikiki so close to everything. The staff were wonderfully friendly and the hotel is clean and well kept - we couldn't fault it at all. Chip on the door is a great guy too :)
reviews.title: 2 Thumbs up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First off, staying right on the beach has it perks. It’s nice going straight to the beach from your room in less then a minute. Of course in Hawaii you’re really not in your room much. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are pretty spacious and clean. I hear from people that stay in Waikiki that there is a lot of city noise but we didn’t notice anything excessive. We were also staying closer to the city side than the beach side. They’ve done a pretty good job keeping up the hotel for how old it is. Dukes Barefoot Bar was a cool place to hang out with nightly live music. The hotel is located right across the street from The International Market Place and several other shopping centers. Also the beach had plenty of open space to just lye out. Overall we were pretty happy with the hotel and were heading back again next month. The only expense that’s kind of a drawback is the parking which cost $25 a night.
reviews.title: Outrigger rocks!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Outrigger Waikiki is a great modern, clean, and well located hotel. Every member of the staff with whom I was in contact was pleasant, well informed and eager to help. The location is right in the middle of Waikiki Beach, with plenty of shops and restaurants in the immediate area. Especially nice was the hospitality room, which was available on the day we departed for a quick shower before heading to the airport. Duke's Canoe Club restaurant was a great place for lunch, dinner, or a breakfast buffet with a view of Diamond Head. Airport shuttles and tour companies pick up right in front of the Outrigger. It was a great place and a terrific value.
reviews.title: Great Hotel;Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 9 nights on first trip to Hawaii with boyf.
reviews.title: Great Location, great service-shame about the thin walls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Greeted before I barely stepped in the door by a charming bellboy who addressed me by my name. What a nice welcome.
reviews.title: 2nd Visit-Still loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room on 2nd floor with view of next doors balconies but a small view of the beach and ocean. Better than having no view. Didn't think I'd be able to see any sea so it was nice surprise.
reviews.title: Great location but............

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As it was our first trip to Hawaii, we booked an ocean front room which was quite expensive.
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel - expensive but worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We drove up with our rental car and was immediately approached by a car valet attendant and bell person. Luggage was unloaded and I was told to go register and luggage would be brought to the riim. Registration was at a desk (sitting down!), In about 10 minutes we were in our room and the luggage then arrived.
reviews.title: Outrigger is okay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Room was attractive, clean, turn down service, with a candy treat each night and a small but truly ocean from balcony. Met every expectation.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel was busy, though much easier to navigate than the larger ones - realtively small.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Waikiki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our room was off to one corner so it was quiet. I imagine that roomes near the elevator could be a bit noisy and many reviews mentioned the noise from the Cheescake factory. Not a problem for use. Ask for the side away from the restaurant when making reservations.
reviews.title: Not Too Impressed

likes.disliked: — customer service, thin walls, and too crowded.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We just came back from a weeklong stay at this hotel. Overall, we were pleased with the Outrigger. We booked on Priceline for $190 a night. The room was big and clean and the staff was friendly. We were on the 7th floor on the Cheesecake Factory side. The fans were pretty ugly, but the noise was not an issue for us. Also, we could see the beach from our room. There were lots of amenities included for no extra charge such as a small refrigerator, safe, high speed Internet, and long distance to the US and Canada (good for us since we have lots of family in Canada). We rented a car and parking was expensive ($25 a day for valet and no self-parking available). We ate at Duke’s, Hula Grill, and Chuck’s. All were very good, and we thought the prices were reasonable for a beachfront hotel in Honolulu. On the down side, the walls did seem pretty thin, but this didn’t cause too much of a problem. The pool is small and the beach area behind the hotel is pretty narrow. Last time we were in Honolulu we stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village, which was definitely more of a luxury hotel with a big beautiful pool area and wide beach. However, I felt like the Outrigger was good value for the price we paid. I would stay here again if the price was right.
reviews.title: Good value

likes.disliked: — Price for parking and thin walls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just returned from a great stay at Outrigger Waikiki on the Beach. We went to relax and that's what we did. I read many of reviews before booking this hotel and I'm glad that I did. When booking....(all hotels in Waikiki ) be sure to ask about construction. There is a lot and many hotels will not let you know unless you ask. The Outrigger was in the perfect spot and no construction. We rented the deluxe beach package every morning at 8:00am at the beach rental cabana. This costs $40.00 and includes two lounge chairs and an umbrella from 8:00 to 5:00pm. You can come and go all day. We were right on the ocean in the front row and it was well worth the money for the reserved space and location. We ate at Dukes, Chuck's Steakhouse, and the Hula Grill. Dukes bar was fun and the food was good. Chuck's was fairly average for the price. Hula Grill was incredible. It has great island decor and a limited menu but terrific food. Be sure to order the crab won tons and the shrimp scampi...they are excellent. There is also a small hidden deli to the far back left of the pool. It is down the walk and near the laundry. Great sandwiches for $5.00-$6.00. We found this and grabbed lunch at the "hidden" deli and ate on the beach. The food was great and we saved money so we could go for a nice dinner. We really loved the Outrigger. Excellent service and great location. I highly recommend this hotel!!!
reviews.title: Great Stay
What a great Hotel
reviews.text: Stayed 11 to 19 Jan 2007. Excellent hotel on arrival we were upgraded from a ocean view room to an ocean front room on the second floor without asking. Room and bedding very clean had a great balcony in full sun all afternoon never needed to rent chairs on the beach. Complimentary everything tea, coffee, in room safe, bottled water on first day and even a daily newspaper. Must be one of the best hotels on the beach 4 star luxury but with a young and informal atmosphere, got breakfast included either in Duke's buffet or Hula grill. Prices for food and drinks probably about the same as Vegas i.e. pricy for US visitors but good value if your from the UK due to the exchange rate. The activities desk were excellent and we visited Pearl harbour on our 25th anniversary we will always remember what we did on that day! Also had a tour of the north shore (half a day) our guide Harry managed to squeeze everything in, including turtle beach where we were lucky to see one of the magnificant turtles sunbathing on the beach.

reviews.title: Wonderful experience!
reviews.text: Flights were by Virgin on an airbus with on demand movies and TV, Hawaiin then flew us from LA to Honolulu rented a digeplayer for $15 (inc 2 headsets) good value as headsets for the plane TV (one film) were $5 each. Cabin crew on both airlines were excellent, previously had bad experience flying with Virgin but on this occasion everything was great and the crew could not have been more polite and helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff was wonderful. Very clean! You can call home for NOTHING on their phone whenever. They supply the postcards and postage. Very polite staff. Feel secure in the hotel. Center of attractions. Easy to get anywhere just ask for assistance. Beach is in back yard and beautiful. Can take surfing lessons, highly recommend no matter what age! I'm 49 and loved it. Took outrigger ride. Loved it. Reasonable. Sunsets are WOW! I had the cheapest room in the hotel and still had a beautiful view of the beach and Diamond Head volcano and the city. Always something to see. Can get a bus to almost anywhere for a reasonable price. Many excursions around the whole island from the hotel or very nearby. Oh, also a newspaper at your door when you get up every morning. Beds were very comfortable. Highly recommend. Also two boats come up on your beach to take you on a sunset sail or whenever. You never have to leave the hotel!
reviews.title: Nice but crowded

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in October of 2005 for the first time based on tripadvisor reviews for the first half of our honeymoon and absolutely loved it. We came back this year for a 6 night stay from October 29th until November 4th and still hold this establishment in high regards.
reviews.title: Great once again! Can't beat the Outrigger.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked an oceanfront room with a king size bed, but upon check in we were given a room with two twin beds. We returned to the front desk and they accomodated us by giving us a king bed on the 10th floor of the hotel.
reviews.title: Great for Honeymooners

likes.disliked: — Probably the maid service because they were slow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room was extremely clean, spacious and had an absolutely gorgeous view of Waikiki beach and Diamondhead. Like others have said, their could be a bit more lighting in the bathroom, but that is really splitting hairs. The room itself was wonderful. We never experienced any problems with noise from adjoining rooms or loud toilet flushes in the oceanfront wing. The maids were always very friendly and Mike the concierge was also extremely helpful if we had questions.
reviews.title: Location Location Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had breakfast for two included with the room and Duke's buffet was excellent, although it is hard not to each too much when you go! The Hula Grill also has really good breakfast; try the stir fried rice with eggs and apple cinnamon french toast, both were very good.
reviews.title: Terrific Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our first trip to Hawaii with my wife and teenage son and daughter. Had a wonderful time and what a wonderful hotel. You are treated like royalty and as long as you get a room high up, Partial or Ocean View on the Diamond head side you should have little problem with noise. Beautiful newly renovated rooms with lots of space. We had a partial ocean view room with a king bed and a pull out sleeper sofa. We also brought an inflatable aerobed and it was great for our daughter.
reviews.title: Busy and Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have wired Internet in the rooms so if you have VOIP like Vonage at home you can bring it with you like we did. Bring a cordless phone so you can call anywhere you need to, even down the street in Hawaii and not worry about long distance charges! The food at all restaurants are excellent and we enjoyed many breakfasts at the Hula Grill and many drinks and meals at Dukes and Chucks. Plan to do lots of walking as there is lots to see, but if you want to drive let me suggest going online with Thrifty car rental as they have convertibles to giant Jeep SUVs at great prices. They are only two blocks away and let you drop off as late as 9pm! Rates are amazing and you can rent online an hour or two before and go pickup! We rented 4 times in 12 days! Cheaper than parking!
reviews.title: happy at the outrigger

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Great golf like being in a rain forest at Luana Hills CC. Worth the half hour drive for the privacy.
reviews.title: Nice place, paper-thin walls...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beaches and water is really great. Beaches are beautiful with a great view in every direction. We saw it all and wiped ourselves out in 10 days so I do not suggest staying here more than 12 days including travel time. There is a weekly luau next door at the Royal Hawaiian that is not very highly rated but was wonderful for us and a quick walk next door. Many others require a two hour drive! Great price and very well done. Get a coupon online for a 20% discount! All in all a great experience and we will be back one day. This hotel is very busy with people everywhere but all of the beauty and friendliness of Hawaii that you hear about is all there at this one hotel! Enjoy!
reviews.title: Outrigger Wakki Shore - great views - but some construction noise
Outrigger Waikiki on the Beach
reviews.text: we have just arrived home to australia from hawaii and we stayed out the outrigger waikiki, we had a great time staying there as it is very central to shops the beach and cafe's. the area is quite safe to walk around any time if the day or night. the international market place is just across the road and ABC stores are every where ( these are like 7-11 stores) they sell every thing. the beach is right out the front and beautiful. we stayed there 3 nights prior to our cruise on the "pride of hawaii" and one night post cruise. i admit we were on the side of the hotel near the cheese cake factory and the fan on the top of that building was noisy but we had the balcony door closed and the aircon on so that didn't worry us at all. the staff were very friendly and helpful which was great. i can highly recommend this hotel as it's location is just the best, we are going back one day and would definately stay there again no doubt at all! any questions you can contact me "rosiepla10@hotmail.com"

aka: Outrigger Waikiki On The Beach Hotel
